award_title: Collaborative Research: CAIG: Understanding radiative feedbacks, ocean heat uptake, and energy conservation to improve ML-climate emulations
subject: Making climate emulator methods reusable (not just citable)
body:
Hi Elizabeth,

Your work on climate emulators and their ability to generalize beyond training data—especially the patch methodology for evaluating physics consistency—addresses a real gap in ML-climate research.

One challenge with computational methods like these: citations capture acknowledgment, but not actual influence. Someone might cite your emulator work without ever running it themselves.

Ouro provides a thin API layer over computational workflows, letting other researchers reuse methods directly instead of recreating them from papers. It makes computational contributions both citable and visibly used.

If you're curious, I can show you how it works.

Hope you get some rest over winter break—happy holidays!

Best,

Matt Moderwell
https://ouro.foundation
